{"step_by_step_thinking": "The Omega-3 Index is a measure of the amount of EPA and DHA, two types of Omega-3 fatty acids, in the red blood cell membranes. It is expressed as a percent of total fatty acids. A higher Omega-3 Index is associated with a lower risk for heart diseases, including coronary heart disease. Therefore, it can be considered as a risk factor for death from coronary heart disease.", "answer_choice": "A. yes"}
